entries.source: Chat Edit: 'the PE detection from other file types worked on the UI local app, but on the server side, other file types are still detected (randomly hardcoded) as malware. Fix it so that other files types are correctly detected as not PE and showed correctly on server. '
Chat Edit: 'it still didn't work even after restarting both the local app and the server '

Chat Edit: 'Think again. What was the root cause of the problem? Was it because there was no condition check for PE file before printing out the jsonsamples, and those json continued to be used by the local app and the server? Will adding some if-statement, or running the file-detector first then only print out jsonsample if the file is PE (if not, only print out the announcement and hashes like already implemented in the local app.) fix the problem?'

Chat Edit: 'There was no condition check for PE file before printing out the jsonsamples, and those json continued to be used by the local app and the server, so the server still showed random json scanning result for file types other than PE. I want to fix that problem by adding some if-statement/ running the file-detector first then only print out jsonsample if the file is PE (if not, only print out the announcement and hashes like already implemented in the local app, and push those to the server). Is it possible or is there any better, cleaner, more efficient way?'
